definition: to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: Microsoft, for instance, remains firmly attached to its Windows operating system (see article).
sentences.chinese: 比如微軟就依然堅定不移地死守視窗操作系統。

sentences.english: Wu won the battle after 3 hours because of the setting. No pursuit.
sentences.chinese: 吳國死守三小時後獲勝，沒有追擊。

sentences.english: Large field belongs to the Japanese Army 43 Division was ordered to hang on the island.
sentences.chinese: 大場所屬的日本陸軍43師團受命死守這個小島。

sentences.english: He's a top player so we're going to have to be on our guard.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位頂級球員，我們必須嚴防死守。

sentences.english: I don't want to be tied to this boring job.
sentences.chinese: 我不願意死守這份讓人厭煩的工作。

sentences.english: The real solution is to punish teams that overcommit to stopping Yao.
sentences.chinese: 真正實際的解決辦法是懲罰嚴防死守姚明的球隊。

definition: to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to strongly defend one's position/to be entrenched/to cling to
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to give up defending/to yield/to surrender
to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
to hold on to/to defend/to keep/to guard
to rely on natural barriers (for one's defense)
